statements.name: PROC HPFUCMSPEC
statements.description: The HPFUCMSPEC procedure is used to create an unobserved component model (UCM) specification file. The output of this procedure is an XML file that stores the intended UCM specification. This XML specification file can be used for different purposes—for example, it can be used to populate the model repository used by the HPFENGINE procedure (see Chapter 5, The HPFENGINE Procedure ). You can specify any UCM that can be analyzed by using the UCM procedure; see Chapter 29, The UCM Procedure (SAS/ETS User's Guide). Moreover, the model specification can include series transformations such as or Box-Cox transformations. Apart from minor modifications to accommodate series transformations, the model specification syntax of the HPFUCMSPEC procedure is similar to that of the UCM procedure.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a descriptive label for the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Names the model specification to be stored in the SAS catalog or external file reference.

arguments.name: REPOSITORY=
arguments.description: Names the SAS catalog or external file reference to contain the model specification.

statements.name: AUTOREG
statements.description: The AUTOREG statement specifies an autoregressive component of the model.

arguments.name: NOEST=
arguments.description: Fixes the values to those specified in RHO= and VARIANCE= options.

arguments.name: RHO
arguments.description: RHO

arguments.name: VARIANCE
arguments.description: VARIANCE

arguments.name: RHO=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the damping factor during the parameter estimation process.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance during the parameter estimation process.

statements.name: BLOCKSEASON
statements.description: The BLOCKSEASON or BLOCKSEASONAL statement is used to specify a seasonal that has a special block structure.

arguments.name: BLOCKSIZE=
arguments.description: Specifies the block size, m.

arguments.name: RHO
arguments.description: RHO

arguments.name: VARIANCE
arguments.description: VARIANCE

arguments.name: NBLOCKS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of blocks, k.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the value of the disturbance variance parameter to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

arguments.name: OFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the position of the first measurement within the block, if the first measurement is not at the start of a block.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of the seasonal component. The default type is DUMMY.

arguments.name: DUMMY
arguments.description: DUMMY

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the start of the parameter estimation process.

statements.name: CYCLE
statements.description: The CYCLE statement is used to specify a cycle component in the model.

arguments.name: NOEST=
arguments.description: Fixes the values of the component parameters to those specified in the RHO=, PERIOD=, and VARIANCE= options.

arguments.name: PERIOD
arguments.description: PERIOD

arguments.name: RHO
arguments.description: RHO

arguments.name: VARIANCE
arguments.description: VARIANCE

arguments.name: PERIOD=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the cycle period during the parameter estimation process. Period value must be strictly larger than 2.

arguments.name: RHO=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the damping factor in this component during the parameter estimation process. Any value in the interval (0, 1), including one but excluding zero, is an acceptable initial value for the damping factor.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance parameter to be used during the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.

statements.name: DEPLAG
statements.description: The DEPLAG statement is used to specify the lags of the forecast variable to be included as predictors in the model.

arguments.name: LAGS=
arguments.description: Syntax: LAGS=order LAGS=(lag, ..., lag ) ...(lag, ..., lag ) LAGS=(lag, ..., lag )<s1> ...(lag, ..., lag )<sk> Defines a model with specified lags. This is a required option in this statement.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the values of the parameters to those specified in PHI= options.

arguments.name: PHI=
arguments.description: Lists starting values for the coefficients of the lagged forecast variable.

statements.name: FORECAST
statements.description: The FORECAST statement specifies the symbolic name that represents the series to be forecast and also specifies an optional transformation to be applied to the series. The symbolic name is used in later steps to associate actual time series variables with the model specification when the specification is applied to data.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a symbolic name for the forecast series. This symbol specification is optional. If the SYMBOL= option is not specified, Y is used as a default symbol.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Specifies the transformation to be applied to the time series.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: The INPUT statements specify the inputs in the model. A separate INPUT statement is needed for each of the inputs. In this statement you can specify the delay order, the differencing orders, and the Box-Cox type transformations associated with the input variable under consideration.

arguments.name: DELAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the delay (or lag) order for the input series.

arguments.name: DIF=
arguments.description: Specifies the differencing orders for the input series.

arguments.name: PREDEFINED=
arguments.description: Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this transfer function.

arguments.name: LINEAR
arguments.description: Linear trend

arguments.name: QUADRATIC
arguments.description: Quadratic trend

arguments.name: CUBIC
arguments.description: Cubic trend

arguments.name: INVERSE
arguments.description: Inverse trend

arguments.name: SEASONAL
arguments.description: Seasonal dummy variables

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies a symbolic name for the input series. This symbol specification is optional.

arguments.name: TRANSFORM=
arguments.description: Associates a predefined trend or a set of seasonal dummy variables with this transfer function.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: No transformation

arguments.name: LOG
arguments.description: Logarithmic transformation

arguments.name: SQRT
arguments.description: Square-root transformation

arguments.name: LOGISTIC
arguments.description: Logistic transformation

arguments.name: BOXCOX
arguments.description: Box-Cox transformation with parameter number where number is between –5 and 5

statements.name: IRREGULAR
statements.description: The IRREGULAR statement is used to include an irregular component in the model. There can be at most one IRREGULAR statement in the model specification.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the value to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for during the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.

statements.name: LEVEL
statements.description: The LEVEL statement is used to include a level component in the model.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the value to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.

statements.name: SEASON
statements.description: The SEASON or the SEASONAL statement is used to specify a seasonal component in the model.

arguments.name: LENGTH=
arguments.description: This option is used to specify the season length s.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the value of the disturbance variance parameter to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the type of the seasonal component. The default type is DUMMY.

arguments.name: DUMMY
arguments.description: DUMMY

arguments.name: TRIG
arguments.description: TRIG

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.

statements.name: SLOPE
statements.description: The SLOPE statement is used to include a slope component in the model.

arguments.name: NOEST
arguments.description: Fixes the value of the disturbance variance to the value specified in the VARIANCE= option.

arguments.name: VARIANCE=
arguments.description: Supplies an initial value for the disturbance variance in the equation, at the start of the parameter estimation process. Any nonnegative value, including zero, is an acceptable starting value.
